Cheesy Chicken and Broccoli Casserole

Jump to Recipe

Are you in search of a comforting dish that seamlessly combines creamy textures and hearty flavors? Look no further than our Cheesy Chicken and Broccoli Casserole! This delightful casserole is not only an easy weeknight dinner solution but also a nutritious option that the whole family will enjoy. Packed with shredded chicken, vibrant broccoli florets, and topped with gooey cheddar cheese, every bite is a taste of home. Plus, it’s a fantastic way to use up leftover chicken or vegetables, making it a smart and economical choice for busy cooks. As you dive into this recipe, you’ll discover how simple ingredients come together to create a dish that is both satisfying and delicious. Whether served as a main course or a side, this casserole is sure to become a staple in your kitchen. Get ready to impress your family and friends with this cheesy goodness!

Ingredients

cooked chicken, shredded

Use rotisserie chicken for a quick and flavorful option. If you need a substitute, shredded turkey or even cooked beans can work well for a vegetarian version.

broccoli florets

Fresh broccoli is ideal, but you can use frozen broccoli florets. If using frozen, thaw and drain excess moisture before adding to the mix.

cream of chicken soup

For a healthier option, use a homemade version with chicken broth and a roux. Alternatively, cream of mushroom soup works well for a vegetarian dish.

cheddar cheese, shredded

Sharp cheddar enhances flavor, but feel free to mix with Monterey Jack or Gouda for added creaminess. For a healthier version, use reduced-fat cheese.

milk

Any milk works, but for a creamier texture, use half-and-half or whole milk. Almond or oat milk can be used for dairy-free alternatives.

garlic powder

Fresh minced garlic can be substituted for a stronger flavor; use about 1-2 cloves. Alternatively, garlic salt can be used if you reduce the added salt.

salt

Adjust salt based on the sodium content of the cream of chicken soup and cheese. Always taste the mixture before baking.

pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper gives the best flavor. For a kick, consider adding red pepper flakes or a dash of cayenne.

breadcrumbs

Panko breadcrumbs will give a crunchier topping. For a gluten-free option, use crushed gluten-free crackers or cornflakes.

butter, melted

If you're looking for a healthier option, substitute with olive oil or melted coconut oil. This can also enhance the flavor profile.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Oven

    Start by preheating your oven to 350°F (175°C). This ensures that the casserole cooks evenly and thoroughly.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Chicken and Broccoli Mixture

    In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of shredded cooked chicken, 2 cups of broccoli florets, 1 can (10.5 oz) of cream of chicken soup, 1/2 cup of milk, 1 teaspoon of garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste. Mix well until all ingredients are evenly distributed. Expert Tip: Using leftover rotisserie chicken can save time and add extra flavor.

  • Step 3: Transfer to Baking Dish

    Transfer the chicken and broccoli mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Spread it out evenly to ensure uniform cooking.
    Note:
    You can use non-stick spray or a little oil to grease the dish.

  • Step 4: Add Cheese

    Sprinkle 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese evenly over the top of the chicken and broccoli mixture. This will create a delicious cheesy layer.
    Tip:
    Feel free to mix different types of cheese for added flavor!

  • Step 5: Prepare Breadcrumb Topping

    In a small bowl, mix 1/2 cup of breadcrumbs with 2 tablespoons of melted butter. Stir until the breadcrumbs are fully coated, then sprinkle this mixture evenly over the cheese layer.

  • Step 6: Bake the Casserole

    Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes, or until the cheese is bubbly and the breadcrumbs are golden brown. Expert Note: Keep an eye on the casserole during the last 10 minutes to prevent burning.

  • Step 7: Cool and Serve

    Once baked, remove the casserole from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving. This helps the layers set and makes it easier to serve.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the best way to shred cooked chicken?

To shred cooked chicken easily, let it cool slightly, then use two forks to pull the meat apart. Alternatively, you can use a stand mixer with a paddle attachment on low speed for a quick shredding option.

How do I prepare broccoli florets for cooking?

To prepare broccoli florets, rinse them under cold water, then cut them into bite-sized pieces. If using fresh broccoli, you can also peel and chop the stalks to use them.

What can I use if I don't have cream of chicken soup?

You can substitute cream of chicken soup with a homemade mixture of 1 cup of chicken broth, 1 tbsp of cornstarch (mixed with 2 tbsp of cold water), and a splash of heavy cream or milk to thicken.

How can I tell if my casserole is done cooking?

Your casserole is done when the cheese is bubbly and the breadcrumbs are golden brown. You can also insert a knife or toothpick into the center; it should come out hot.

How do I prevent the casserole from sticking to the dish?

To prevent sticking, ensure you grease the baking dish well with cooking spray, oil, or butter before adding the mixture.

Can I make this casserole ahead of time?

Yes! You can prepare the casserole ahead and store it in the fridge for up to 24 hours before baking. Just cover it tightly with plastic wrap.

What should I do if I don’t have breadcrumbs?

If you don’t have breadcrumbs, you can crush crackers, use panko, or even crushed cornflakes as a substitute for a crunchy topping.

How do I know how much salt and pepper to add?

Start with a small amount, like a pinch of salt and a few cracks of pepper. Taste the mixture before baking to adjust the seasoning to your preference.

What are some variations I can try with this casserole?

You can add cooked rice or quinoa for extra texture, use different vegetables like carrots or peas, or swap out the cheddar cheese for mozzarella or a cheese blend.

How can I safely handle hot dishes from the oven?

Always use oven mitts or pot holders when handling hot dishes. Make sure to place your casserole on a heat-resistant surface to avoid burns.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For those with dietary restrictions, you can modify the recipe by using gluten-free breadcrumbs or a gluten-free cream of chicken soup alternative. To make it lighter, consider using low-fat or dairy-free cheese and milk options. For a vegetarian version, substitute the cooked chicken with chickpeas or a plant-based protein, ensuring that the cream of chicken soup is replaced with a suitable vegetable alternative.

Pairings

For a delightful meal, pair the Cheesy Chicken and Broccoli Casserole with a crisp green salad dressed with a light vinaigrette to balance the richness of the casserole. If you're looking for a protein boost, consider serving it with grilled lemon herb chicken or baked salmon. As for beverages, a chilled glass of Chardonnay or a light-bodied Pinot Grigio complements the creamy flavors beautifully. For a non-alcoholic option, a sparkling water with a squeeze of lemon works well.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the casserole hot, directly from the oven in the baking dish for a rustic, homey feel. For added texture and flavor, garnish each portion with freshly chopped parsley or chives before serving. Consider offering a side of warm, crusty bread to mop up any cheesy goodness left on the plate. This dish is perfect for family gatherings or potlucks, as it can be made ahead of time and reheated.

Cheesy Chicken and Broccoli Casserole

45 min
$12
450 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

DairyWheat

Dietary Tags:

High ProteinComfort Food

Cuisine:

American

Course:

Main Dish

Tags:

CasseroleEasyQuick

Description

A creamy and cheesy casserole packed with tender chicken and nutritious broccoli, perfect for a comforting family meal.

Ingredients

  • cooked chicken, shredded: 2 cups
  • broccoli florets: 2 cups
  • cream of chicken soup: 1 can (10.5 oz)
  • cheddar cheese, shredded: 1 cup
  • milk: 1/2 cup
  • garlic powder: 1 tsp
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste
  • breadcrumbs: 1/2 cup
  • butter, melted: 2 tbsp
